summary: This is an FBI internal request form from the Miami field office to the Records Management Division and Special Technologies and Applications Office, requesting scanning and automation assistance for telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The document reveals Rodriguez was Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager who attempted to sell an address book believed to contain contact information for additional underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009; came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers of what are believed to be additional underage victims of Epstein and attempted to sell it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of a child prostitution case; Alfredo Rodriguez was his former house manager and butler.

persons.name: William Oswald
persons.context: Appears as the contact/author on the FBI internal request form from the Miami field office.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book believed to contain information on Epstein's underage victims and attempted to sell it rather than turn it over to authorities.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager.

events.title: Telephone records collection period
events.description: Telephone records were generated between September 1, 2001 and the present (June 2010) for the investigation.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager and butler, was the subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers believed to belong to additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book to an Undercover Employee (UCE) rather than turn it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.
The FBI was processing telephone records (target number 340-771-1339) from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims.
The document is an internal FBI request for technical assistance to scan and automate these telephone records for incorporation into the Bureau's Telephone Application (TA) investigative database.
